Extinction of current species: If humans were able to live for 500 years, it is possible that some species may become extinct due to their inability to adapt to the changing environment.
Overpopulation: With a longer lifespan, the population of humans could continue to grow at an exponential rate, leading to overpopulation and strain on resources.
Technological advancements: With more time to live, humans could continue to advance technology at a faster rate, leading to new discoveries and innovations.
Cultural and societal changes: A longer lifespan could lead to changes in cultural and societal norms, as people have more time to pursue their passions and interests.
Climate change: With a longer lifespan, humans could continue to contribute to climate change through their consumption anden habits, leading to even more severe consequences for the planet.
